title: Textual-to-Visual Iterative Self-Verification for Slide Generation
author: Yunqing Xu (Xi'an Jiao Tong University), Xinbei Ma (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Jiyang Qiu (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Hai Zhao (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses methods for generating visual content from textual descriptions, which could inform approaches for audio-visual generation, potentially benefiting audio-synthesis tasks that require visual context.
background: Automated presentation slide generation by decomposing the task into content creation and visual layout design.
contribution: This paper introduces a dual-phase method combining text-based content generation and visual layout refinement to improve coherence and visual alignment in academic slides.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with layout consistency and refinement, often generating rigid and misaligned outputs.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work introduces a textual-to-visual verification process that allows for intuitive layout corrections, improving visual appeal and alignment.

key_innovation: Leveraging a Reviewer + Refiner workflow to iteratively enhance slide layouts by converting textual data into visual formats for better assessments.
real_world_impact: This framework could significantly reduce the time required for academic presentation preparation, enhancing the way researchers communicate findings.
limitations: The dataset used is limited to academic papers and may not generalize to other presentation formats.

new_terms.textual-to-visual self-verification: **Textual-to-visual self-verification** refers to the process of converting textual layout information into visual formats to allow for better human-like assessments and corrections.
new_terms.LLM-based Reviewer + Refiner: **LLM-based Reviewer + Refiner** is a framework using large language models to evaluate and refine generated content based on visual feedback.
